solution_line_template: On Saturday, he threw the ball {saturday_throws} times, and since the temperature was 50 degrees, he could throw only {saturday_yards_per_throw} yards, totaling {saturday_throws}*{saturday_yards_per_throw} = <<{saturday_throws}*{saturday_yards_per_throw}={saturday_total}>>{saturday_total} yards.

On Sunday, the temperature favored him, and he threw the ball twice the distance he could throw on Saturday, which is {sunday_multiplier}*{saturday_yards_per_throw} = <<{sunday_multiplier}*{saturday_yards_per_throw}={sunday_yards_per_throw}>>{sunday_yards_per_throw} yards.
If he threw the ball {sunday_throws} times, he threw for {sunday_throws}*{sunday_yards_per_throw} = <<{sunday_throws}*{sunday_yards_per_throw}={sunday_total}>>{sunday_total} yards.
In the two days, he threw {sunday_total}+{saturday_total} = <<{sunday_total}+{saturday_total}={total_yards}>>{total_yards} yards.
